intro: Euploca katangensis, commonly known as the Katanga euploca, is a flowering plant native to the Democratic Republic of the Congo. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and showy, violet-colored flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, tropical environments and is often found in swampy or marshy areas. Its botanical features include palmate leaves and a preference for humid, nutrient-rich soils. Euploca katangensis is of interest to botanists due to its unique ecological adaptations and limited distribution.
